androidApp.techDescription: The app is built using the latest technologies to ensure the best performance and security
features: Advanced authentication system (registration, login, password reset)
Product browsing and advanced search functions
Shopping cart management (add, delete, update quantity)
Product and category management (display, categorization, discounted products)
Scalable order management system with tracking
Responsive design for different screen sizes
Provider-based state management for high performance
Performance and security optimizations (memory leak prevention)
Dynamic currency code updates from Firebase

Getting Started with Firebase (for Android App) This Android application uses Firebase for secure authentication, including Google Sign-in. To set it up: Create a Firebase Project: Go to the Firebase Console and create a new project. Add Android App to Firebase: Register your Android app in the Firebase project. Remember to add the SHA-1 fingerprint and download google-services.json. Enable Google Sign-in: In Firebase Authentication, enable Google as a sign-in method. Integrate Firebase SDK: Add Firebase SDK dependencies to your Gradle files. For detailed instructions and code examples, please refer to the Firebase Setup and Google Sign-in section in the project's README.md file.
